InstructionText: Fry chicken in butter in at least two portions. Season with salt and pepper. Remove after approx. 3 minutes, once the chicken has a dark golden color
Saute the onions in the same skillet until soft (translucent)
Powder flour over the onions and cook 1-2 minutes
Slowly add chicken broth, stirring until smooth.
Spice the gravy with lemon juice, white wine, salt, and pepper. Simmer 5 mintues.
Add chicken and cook to 165°F. Remove from heat.
Mix egg yolk and heavy cream in a separate bowl. Add to the chicken and gravy and mix well.
In a large mixing bowl, beat butter, brown sugar, and sugar for 4 minutes until light and fluffy.
Add molasses and egg and mix for 1 minute longer.
Fold in flour, baking soda, corn starch, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, and chocolate chips.
Roll into 4-ounce, 5-ounce, or 6-ounce balls. Place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. I prefer to use light-colored baking sheets.

Bake for 8-10 minutes. The cookies will be slightly underdone when you remove them from the oven. Let the cookies sit for 10-15 minutes before moving them from the baking sheet to a wire cooling rack.
